text:
318-322 E. Kingsbridge Road, west side, at its junction with E. Fordham Road, showing two similar views of J. Stroud's general store. Fordham Road was called Fordham Landing Road in the 1870's and High Bridge Road in the 1860's. The G. W. Bromley map of 1924 as revised to September 1932 shows the site to be occupied by a 2-story brick building.

1870

James Locke
Gift of Edmund B. Child

E. Fordham Road (right), at E. Kingsbridge Road (left), showing the small public place, known as John E. Bryan Park, being improved by the Works Progress Administration. The view is eastward.

August 10, 1937

W.P.A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project

313 to 329 (left to right) E. Fordham Road, east side, at its junction with E. Kingsbridge Road. No. 313 is the Windsor Theatre.

May 11, 1938.

P. L. Sperr
